title: my (low grade)t206's for your 1951 or 1950 Bowmans?
author: ClownQuestionBro

posts.post_title: my (low grade)t206's for your 1951 or 1950 Bowmans?
posts.post_content:
im changing directions on my card collecting and want to focus more on my 1951 Bowman set (also 1950). I have 8 lower condition Boston Americans t206 cards to trade, hopefully for a small lot of bowman cards from those sets. I dont mind and even prefer lower grade Bowmans in return. (Quantity over quality.)

I have:
Frank Arellanes
Bill Carrigan
Red Kleinow (in a PSA hard candy shell)
Harry Lord
Harry Niles
Tubby Spenser
Jake Stahl (glove)
Heinie Wagner (bat on left shoulder)

Pm me if interested. i'll try to post pics when i get home. thanks
I have about 50 1949 Bowman that I really don't need...   would much prefer to have some T206's.   They are all nice condition, value around $600 if you or anyone else is interested.  PM me.

I'm in a similar situation... have no use for these three.  I can kick in a few bucks and you can pick a T206 to send me.  Or, instead of cash, I have three 1952 Bowman as well.  I'm not picky.  Send me a PM:
